alert.note: Alert for Leon (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following county, Leon. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Florida A and M, Florida State University, Doak Campbell Stadium, Walker Ford Community Center, Bragg Stadium, South City, All Saints District, Cascades Park, Leon County Civic Center, North Florida Fairgrounds, State Capital Complex, Apalachee Ridge Estates, Kleman Plaza, Gene Cox Stadium, Gaither Community Center, Jack McLean Park, Springsax Park, Providence Neighborhood and Callen Neighborhood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
